linkEmbed.description: Women's fencer Stephanie Turner refused to compete against a transgender competitor at a competition this weekend and was punished and escorted out.
linkEmbed.title: Women's fencer opens up on refusing to face transgender opponent, accepting punishment and backlash

twitter.content:
"So when I took the knee, I looked at the ref and I said, ‘I’m sorry, I cannot do this. I am a woman, and this is a man, and this is a women's tournament. And I will not fence this individual.'"

It really can be explained this simply. Amazing.

posts.raw_content:
I work in IT, with clients all over the world. For many of them, I invoice in USD. This means my pay is directly related to the USD-SEK conversion rate. 

As an example, if I invoice 1000 USD, I'm expecting ~10000 SEK from that work. Right now, my return is quickly heading towards 7000-8000 SEK instead, for the same amount of USD. Which is a huge paycut for me, but, the implications of this is far more important, it means:

US Exports become way more competitive
US Imports become more expensive
Which in turn fosters domestic production of goods and services in the US

I can't help but respect the game. I'm very happy that you guys are headed in the right direction, but oh man do I wish my country had competent leaders! 

MAGA/MSGA

posts.raw_content:
Let’s cut through the noise: the United States and Europe aren’t on the same page anymore. From where I’m standing—outside the American heartland but watching close—Europe’s gone off the deep end with its globalist, woke obsession, while the USA still fights for the stuff that matters: freedom, faith, and a backbone. And here’s the kicker—Russia, the big bad bear of old, looks more like America’s kindred spirit these days than the latte-sipping Eurocrats do. Maybe it’s time for the USA to ditch the sinking ship of Europe and link arms with a nation that actually gets it.

Europe’s a mess, plain and simple. The EU’s turned into a control-freak nightmare—unelected suits in Brussels barking orders at countries, stomping out their sovereignty like it’s nothing. Free speech? Toast. Say something “offensive” online, and you’re hauled off in cuffs. They’ve swapped God for green agendas and gender-bender propaganda, pushing it on kids while letting migrants overrun their borders. It’s not just progressive—it’s a full-on globalist cult, erasing history, culture, and common sense. Sounds like a horror show to anyone who values a nation’s right to be itself.

Then there’s the USA. Sure, you’ve got your coastal elites trying to copy Europe’s playbook, but the real America—the flyover states, the truckers, the churchgoers—ain’t buying it. They’re armed to the teeth with their Second Amendment, proud of their flag, and not afraid to tell the world to shove it. That’s grit. That’s independence. They’re not bowing to some international overlord or crying about “carbon footprints” while their jobs get shipped overseas. It’s a country that still believes in itself, even if the lefties want to turn it into Europe 2.0.
Now, take a hard look at Russia. Yeah, Putin’s no saint, but hear me out. They’re not messing around with woke nonsense—no drag queen story hours or “diversity quotas” over there. They’re all about family, church, and keeping their borders tight—stuff that’d make a MAGA rally cheer. Russia’s got a strongman vibe, sure, but they’re not begging anyone for handouts or apologizing for who they are. They’ve got an army that means business, not some underfunded NATO joke leaning on Uncle Sam to save the day. It’s raw, unapologetic nationalism—sound familiar, America?

Europe’s a lost cause for the USA. They’ve been riding America’s coattails in NATO forever, whining about “climate justice” while the U.S. foots the bill. Russia doesn’t need babysitting—they’re a partner that can pull its weight. Picture it: the USA and Russia, two powerhouses telling the globalists where to stick their open-borders fantasy. Europe can keep its rainbow flags and windmills; America’s got bigger fish to fry, and Russia’s at the table ready to eat.

This isn’t about ideology or picking sides in some moral crusade. It’s about who’s got your back in a world gone crazy. Europe’s too busy hugging trees and banning plastic straws to stand with the USA. Russia? They’re not perfect, but they’re closer to that American fire—tough, proud, and done with the woke garbage. The old alliance with Europe’s fading fast, and maybe that’s not a bad thing. The USA could do worse than shaking hands with Moscow and leaving Brussels in the dust.
